column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Paint Corners
#Text=Whether it 's a large or small project , there 's a good chance that most painting tasks will involve corners .
#Text=Although it can be a tricky process at first , any corner can be painted with the proper taping preparations and short , careful brush strokes .
#Text=With a little bit of patience , you will be able to work through your home painting projects with efficiency !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Protecting and Sealing the Paint Site
#Text=Set up a step stool next to the painting site .
#Text=Before you start painting , you will want to make sure that the spot you plan on painting is easily accessible .
#Text=If necessary , set up a small step stool or ladder to help you reach the area that you 'll be painting .
#Text=Being closer to the corner will allow you to make steadier , more confident strokes .
#Text=This can help make your paint job look more professional .
#Text=If you 're using a ladder , always have a person nearby to spot you .
#Text=This can help to prevent any potential injuries .
#Text=Wipe the corner baseboard with a moist cloth to remove any dust .
#Text=You will be applying painter ’s tape to prevent any paint from dripping into unwanted areas , so you want to make sure that there is no lingering dust .
#Text=Wait for the wiped surface to dry before applying any painter 's tape .
#Text=Painter 's tape will have a smoother application along a clean surface .
#Text=Wipe with a phosphate-free detergent product if the wall or corner area appears to be greasy .
#Text=This solution can be found at most hardware and home improvement stores .
#Text=If you are working on a ceiling area , wipe down wherever you expect to be placing painter ’s tape .
#Text=Cut a long strip of painter 's tape .
#Text=The length of this strip will depend on the length of your wall .
#Text=Place the tape along the floor baseboard .
#Text=Choose a starting point along the edge and ensure that the piece of tape is long enough to reach the corner .
#Text=Make the piece of tape longer than necessary to ensure that the corner ’s edges are completely covered .
#Text=Medium adhesion painter ’s tape is a good choice for painted walls , and will help prevent any damage to the wall during the tape removal process .
#Text=Using a painter 's tape applicator can help to make the taping process much more efficient .
#Text=They are available at most stores that sell painting supplies .
#Text=When painting a ceiling corner , secure the painter ’s tape along the edge where the ceiling meets the wall .
#Text=Secure the painter 's tape to the wall with a putty knife .
#Text=Drag the putty knife along any loose sections of painter ’s tape so that they adhere tightly to the wall .
#Text=Once you have securely bonded the tape to the corner , use a utility knife or other small blade to cut off anything extra .
#Text=A one and a half inch wide putty knife is a good size for most painting projects .
#Text=Repeat the taping and sealing process .
#Text=Using another long strip of painter 's tape , cover the other adjoining edge of the wall with painter 's tape .
#Text=Secure this piece of tape with the putty knife .
#Text=Since you already cut the extra tape off of the first strip , the second strip will be easier to secure to the wall and corner .
#Text=Apply long strips of painter ’s tape around nearby moldings as needed .
#Text=This process will be identical to the rest of the taping process .
#Text=Applying the Paint
#Text=Begin to fill the corner with paint .
#Text=Use a two-and-a-half inch wide brush and liberally dip into the paint .
#Text=Start by using your brush to apply paint from the innermost crevice .
#Text=This will make it easier to paint the areas immediately surrounding the corner .
#Text=If you are painting near a baseboard , be sure to have drop cloths or plastic sheeting laid out to prevent any paint from spilling on the floor .
#Text=If you prefer to use a roller in your painting , consider using a square paint edger .
#Text=This tool is a mix of a brush and a roller , and will help you reach the inner parts of the corner .
#Text=Use an extension pole if necessary .
#Text=Spread the paint in outward strokes .
#Text=You will want to keep your brushstrokes short so that you can spread the paint evenly across a small area .
#Text=Aim to paint at least five short strokes from your initial paint placement .
#Text=Edge rollers can also be effective in providing consistent paint coverage along a straight line .
#Text=Keep brushing in short strokes to hide any brush marks .
#Text=Given the small amount of painting space in a corner , there is a chance that you have lingering brush marks that are visible to the naked eye .
#Text=Give extra care to even out parallel strokes of paint with perpendicular ones .
#Text=Switch to a roller to get consistent paint coverage .
#Text=While a roller may not be able to reach a corner ’s crevice , it can help to flatten and level out the existing paint that you have already applied with a brush .
#Text=Using a roller also eliminates any worry of lasting brush strokes .
#Text=Take off the painter 's tape .
#Text=Once the paint has dried , press down on the top of the tape with the thin edge of a putty knife .
#Text=You will then want to pull the tape off in a clean , steady motion .
#Text=Ideally , you will want the tape to be forming a 45-degree angle as you remove it from the wall .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Wet wipes
#Text=Painter 's tape
#Text=Paint brush
#Text=Paint roller
#Text=Paint roller extension pole ( optional )
#Text=Square paint edger
#Text=Putty knife
#Text=Utility knife
#Text=Paint
#Text=Disposable gloves ( optional )
#Text=Drop cloths ( optional )
#Text=Plastic sheeting ( optional )
#Text=Step stool ( optional )
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Wear a mask if you plan on painting for an extended period of time .
